name: Air Lock
effect: Eliminates the effects of weather

name: Arena Trap
effect: Prevents opposing Pokemon from fleeing

name: Battle Armor
effect: Hard armor protects the Pokemon from critical hits

name: Blaze
effect: Powers up Fire-type moves when the Pokemon's HP is low

name: Cacophony
effect: Avoids Sound-based Moves

name: Chlorophyll
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight

name: Clear Body
effect: Prevents other Pokemon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokemon's stats

name: Cloud Nine
effect: Eliminates the effects of weather

name: Color Change
effect: The Pokemon's type becomes the type of the move used on it

name: Compound Eyes
effect: The Pokemon's compound eyes boost its accuracy

name: Cute Charm
effect: Contact with the Pokemon may caused infatuation

name: Damp
effect: Prevents the use of explosive moves, such as Self-Destruct, by dampening its surroundings

name: Drizzle
effect: The Pokemon makes it rain when it enters a battle

name: Drought
effect: Turns the sunlight harsh when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Early Bird
effect: The Pokemon awakens from sleep twice as fast as other Pokemon

name: Effect Spore
effect: Contact with the Pokemon may inflict poison, sleep, or paralysis on its attacker

name: Flame Body
effect: Contact with the Pokemon may burn the attacker

name: Flash Fire
effect: Powers up the Pokemon's Fire-type moves if it's hit by one

name: Forecast
effect: The Pokemon transforms with the weather to change its type to Water, Fire, or Ice

name: Guts
effect: It's so gutsy that having a status condition boosts the Pokemon's Attack stat

name: Huge Power
effect: Doubles the Pokemon's Attack stat

name: Hustle
effect: Boosts the Attack stat, but lowers accuracy

name: Hyper Cutter
effect: The Pokemon's proud of its powerful pincers. They prevent other Pokemon from lowering its Attack stat

name: Illuminate
effect: Raises the likelihood of meeting wild Pokemon by illuminating the surroundings

name: Immunity
effect: The immune system of the Pokemon prevents it from getting poisoned

name: Inner Focus
effect: The Pokemon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokemon from flinching

name: Insomnia
effect: The Pokemon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep

name: Intimidate
effect: The Pokemon intimidates opposing Pokemon upon entering battle, lowering their Attack stat

name: Keen Eye
effect: Keen eyes prevent other Pokemon from lowering this Pokemon's accuracy

name: Levitate
effect: By floating in the air, the Pokemon receives full immunity to all Ground-type moves

name: Lightning Rod
effect: The Pokemon draws in all Electric-type moves. Instead of being hit by Electric-type moves, it boosts its Sp. Atk

name: Limber
effect: Its limber body protects the Pokemon from paralysis

name: Liquid Ooze
effect: The oozed liquid has a strong stench, which damages attackers using any draining move

name: Magma Armor
effect: The Pokemon is covered with hot magma, which prevents the Pokemon from becoming frozen

name: Magnet Pull
effect: Prevents Steel-type Pokemon from escaping using its magnetic force

name: Marvel Scale
effect: The Pokemon's marvelous scales boost the Defense stat if it has a status condition

name: Minus
effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokemon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle

name: Natural Cure
effect: All status conditions heal when the Pokemon switches out

name: Oblivious
effect: The Pokemon is oblivious, and that keeps it from being infatuated or falling for taunts

name: Overgrow
effect: Powers up Grass-type moves when the Pokemon's HP is low

name: Own Tempo
effect: This Pokemon has its own temp, and htat prevents it from becoming confused

name: Pickup
effect: The Pokemon may pick up the item an opposing Pokemon used during a battle. It may pick up items outside of battle, too

name: Plus
effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat on the Pokemon if an ally with the Plus or Minus Ability is also in battle

name: Poison Point
effect: Contact with the Pokemon may poison the attacker

name: Pressure
effect: By putting pressure on the opposing Pokemon, it raises their PP usage

name: Pure Power
effect: Using its pure power, the Pokemon doubles its Attack stat

name: Rain Dish
effect: The Pokemon gradually regains HP in rain

name: Rock Head
effect: Protects the Pokemon from recoil damage

name: Rough Skin
effect: This Pokemon inflicts damage with its rough skin to the attacker on contact

name: Run Away
effect: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokemon

name: Sand Stream
effect: The Pokemon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle

name: Sand Veil
effect: Boots the Pokemon's evasiveness in a sandstorm

name: Serene Grace
effect: Boosts the likelihood of additional effects occuring when attacking

name: Shadow Tag
effect: This Pokemon steps on the opposing Pokemon's shadow to prevent it from escaping

name: Shed Skin
effect: The Pokemon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin

name: Shell Armor
effect: A hard shell protects the Pokemon from critical hits

name: Shield Dust
effect: This Pokemon's dust blocks the additional effects of attacks taken

name: Soundproof
effect: Soundproofing gives the Pokemon full immunity to all sound-based moves

name: Speed Boost
effect: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn

name: Static
effect: The Pokemon is charged with static electricity, so contact with it may cause paralysis

name: Stench
effect: By releasing stench when attacking, this Pokemon may cause hte target to flinch

name: Sticky Hold
effect: Items held by the Pokemon are stuck fast and cannot be removed by other Pokemon

name: Sturdy
effect: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out either

name: Suction Cups
effect: This Pokemon uses suction cups to stay in one spot to negate all moves and items that force switching out

name: Swarm
effect: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokemon's HP is low

name: Swift Swim
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Speed stat in rain

name: Synchronize
effect: The attacker will receive the same status condition if it inflicts a burn, poison, or paralysis to the Pokemon

name: Thick Fat
effect: The Pokemon is protected by a layer of thick fat, which halves the damage taken from Fire- and Ice-type moves

name: Torrent
effect: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokemon's HP is low

name: Trace
effect: When it enters a battle, the Pokemon copies an opposing Pokemon's Ability

name: Truant
effect: The Pokemon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn

name: Vital Spirit
effect: The Pokemon is full of vitality, and that prevents it from falling asleep

name: Volt Absorb
effect: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage

name: Water Absorb
effect: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move instead of taking damage

name: Water Veil
effect: The Pokemon is covered with a water veil, which prevents the Pokemon from getting a burn

name: White Smoke
effect: The Pokemon is protected by its white smoke, which prevents other Pokemon from lowering its stats

name: Wonder Guard
effect: Its mysterious power only lets supereffective moves hit the Pokemon

name: Adaptability
effect: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokemon

name: Aftermath
effect: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokemon with a finishing hit

name: Anger Point
effect: The Pokemon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat

name: Anticipation
effect: The Pokemon can sense an opposing Pokemon's dangerous moves

name: Bad Dreams
effect: Reduces the HP of sleeping opposing Pokemon

name: Download
effect: Compares an opposing Pokemon's Defense and Sp. Def stats before raising its own Attack or Sp. Atk stat - whichever will be more effective

name: Dry Skin
effect: Restores HP in rain or when hit by Water-type moves. Reduces HP in harsh sunlight, and increases the damage received from Fire-type moves

name: Filter
effect: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken

name: Flower Gift
effect: Boosts the Attack and Sp. Def stats of itself and allies in harsh sunlight

name: Forewarn
effect: When it enters a battle, the Pokemon can tell one of the moves an opposing Pokemon has

name: Frisk
effect: When it enters a battle, the Pokemon can check an opposing Pokemon's held item

name: Gluttony
effect: Makes the Pokemon eat a held Berry when its HP drops to half or less, which is sooner than usual

name: Heatproof
effect: The heatproof body of the Pokemon halves the damage from Fire-type moves that hit it

name: Honey Gather
effect: The Pokemon may gather Honey after a battle

name: Hydration
effect: Heals status conditions if it's raining

name: Ice Body
effect: The Pokemon gradually regains HP in a hailstorm

name: Iron Fist
effect: Powers up punching moves

name: Klutz
effect: The Pokemon can't use any held items

name: Leaf Guard
effect: Prevents status conditions in harsh sunlight

name: Magic Guard
effect: The Pokemon only takes damage from attacks

name: Mold Breaker
effect: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities

name: Motor Drive
effect: Boosts its Speed stat if hit by an Electric-type move instead of taking damage

name: Multitype
effect: Changes the Pokemon's type to match the Plate or Z-Crystal it holds

name: No Guard
effect: The Pokemon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land

name: Normalize
effect: All the Pokemon's moves become Normal type. The power of those moves is boosted a little

name: Poison Heal
effect: Restores HP if the Pokemon is poisoned instead of losing HP

name: Quick Feet
effect: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokemon has a status condition

name: Reckless
effect: Powers up moves that have recoil damage

name: Rivalry
effect: Becomes competitive and deals more damage to Pokemon of the same gender, but deals less to Pokemon of the opposite gender

name: Scrappy
effect: The Pokemon can hit Ghost-type Pokemon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves

name: Simple
effect: The stat changes the Pokemon receives are doubled

name: Skill Link
effect: Maximizes the number of times multistrike moves hit

name: Slow Start
effect: For five turns, the Pokemon's Attack and Speed stats are halved

name: Sniper
effect: Powers up moves if they become critical hits when attacking

name: Snow Cloak
effect: Boosts evasiveness in hailstorm

name: Snow Warning
effect: The Pokemon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle

name: Solar Power
effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight, but HP descreases every turn

name: Solid Rock
effect: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken

name: Stall
effect: The Pokemon moves after all other Pokemon do

name: Steadfast
effect: The Pokemon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokemon flinches

name: Storm Drain
effect: draws in all Water-type moves. Instead of being hit by Water-type moves, it boosts it's Sp. Atk

name: Super Luck
effect: The Pokemon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted

name: Tangled Feet
effect: Raises evasiveness if the Pokemon is confused

name: Technician
effect: Powers up the Pokemon's weaker moves

name: Tinted Lens
effect: The Pokemon can use 'not very effective' moves to deal regular damage

name: Unaware
effect: When attacking, the Pokemon ignores the target Pokemon's stat changes

name: Unburden
effect: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokemon's held item is used or lost

name: Analytic
effect: Boosts move power when the Pokemon moves last

name: Big Pecks
effect: Protects the Pokemon from Defense-lowering effects

name: Contrary
effect: Makes stat changes ahve an opposite effect

name: Cursed Body
effect: May disable a move used on the Pokemon

name: Defeatist
effect: Halves the Pokemon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less

name: Defiant
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered

name: Flare Boost
effect: Powers up special attacks when the Pokemon is burned

name: Friend Guard
effect: Reduces damage done to allies

name: Harvest
effect: May create another Berry after one is used

name: Healer
effect: Sometimes heals an ally's status condition

name: Heavy Metal
effect: Doubles the Pokemon's weight

name: Illusion
effect: Comes out disguised as the Pokemon in the part's last spot

name: Imposter
effect: The Pokemon transforms itself into the Pokemon it's facing

name: Infiltrator
effect: Passes through the opposing Pokemon's barrier, substitue, and the like and strikes

name: Iron Barbs
effect: Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact with iron barbs

name: Justified
effect: Being hit by a Dark-type move boosts the Attack stat of the Pokemon, for justice

name: Light Metal
effect: Halves the Pokemon's weight

name: Magic Bounce
effect: Reflects status moves instead of getting hit by them

name: Moody
effect: Raises one stat sharply and lowers another every turn

name: Moxie
effect: The Pokemon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokemon

name: Multiscale
effect: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokemon takes while its HP is full

name: Mummy
effect: Contact with the Pokemon changes the attacker's Ability to Mummy

name: Overcoat
effect: Protects the Pokemon from things like sand, hail, and powder

name: Pickpocket
effect: Steals an item from an attacker that made direct contact

name: Poison Touch
effect: May poison a target when the Pokemon makes contact

name: Prankster
effect: Gives priority to a status move

name: Rattled
effect: Dark-, Ghost-, and Bug-type moves scare the Pokemon and boost its Speed stat

name: Regenerator
effect: Restores a little HP when withdrawn from battle

name: Sand Force
effect: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm

name: Sand Rush
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Speed stat in a sandstorm

name: Sap Sipper
effect: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move instead of taking damage

name: Sheer Force
effect: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking

name: Telepathy
effect: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it

name: Teravolt
effect: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities

name: Toxic Boost
effect: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokemon is poisoned

name: Turboblaze
effect: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities

name: Unnerve
effect: Unnerves opposing Pokmeon and makes them unable to eat Berries

name: Victory Star
effect: Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself

name: Weak Armor
effect: Physical attacks to the Pokemon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Sped stat

name: Wonder Skin
effect: Makes status moves more likely to miss

name: Zen Mode
effect: Changes the Pokemon's shape when HP is half or less

name: Aerilate
effect: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little

name: Aroma Veil
effect: Protects itself and its allies from attacks that limit their move choices

name: Aura Break
effect: The effects of 'Aura' Abilities are reveresed to lower the power of affected moves

name: Bulletproof
effect: Protects the Pokemon from some ball and bomb moves

name: Cheek Pouch
effect: Restores HP as well when the Pokemon eats a Berry

name: Competitive
effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered

name: Dark Aura
effect: Powers up each Pokemon's Dark-type moves

name: Delta Stream
effect: The Pokmeon changes the weather to eliminate all of the Flying type's weakness

name: Desolate Land
effect: The Pokemon changes the weather to nullify Water-type attacks

name: Fairy Aura
effect: Powers up each Pokemon's Fairy-type moves

name: Flower Veil
effect: Ally Grass-type Pokemon are protected from status conditions and the lowering of their stats

name: Fur Coat
effect: Halves the damage from physical moves

name: Gale Wings
effect: Gives priority to Flying-type moves when the Pokemon's HP is full

name: Gooey
effect: Contact with the Pokemon lowers the attacker's Speed stat

name: Grass Pelt
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Defense stat on Grassy Terrain

name: Magician
effect: The Pokemon steals the held item of a Pokemon it hits with a move

name: Mega Launcher
effect: Powers up aura and pulse moves

name: Parental Bond
effect: Parent and child each attacks

name: Pixilate
effect: Normal-type moves become Fairy-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little

name: Primordial Sea
effect: The Pokemon changes the waether to nullify Fire-type attacks

name: Protean
effect: Changes the Pokemon's type to the type of the move it's about to use

name: Refrigerate
effect: Normal-type moves becomes Ice-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little

name: Stance Change
effect: The Pokemon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield

name: Strong Jaw
effect: The Pokemon's strong jaw boosts the powr of its biting moves

name: Sweet Veil
effect: Prevents itself and ally Pokemon from falling asleep

name: Symbiosis
effect: The Pokemon passes its item to an ally that has used up an item

name: Tough Claws
effect: Powers up moves that make direct contact-

name: Battery
effect: Powers up ally Pokemon's special moves

name: Battle Bond
effect: Defeating an opposing Pokemon strengthens the Pokemon's bond with its Trainer. Water Shuriken gets more powerful

name: Beast Boost
effect: The Pokemon boosts tits most profiecient stat each time it knocks out a Pokemon

name: Berserk
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less

name: Comatose
effect: It's always drowsing and will never wake up. It can attack without waking up

name: Corrosion
effect: The Pokemon can poison the target even if it's a Steel or Poison type

name: Dancer
effect: When another Pokemon uses a dance move, it can use a dance move following it regardless of its Speed

name: Dazzling
effect: Surprises the opposing Pokemon, amking it unable to attack using priority moves

name: Disguise
effect: Once per battle, the shroud that covers the Pokemon can protect it from an attack

name: Electric Surge
effect: Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Emergency Exit
effect: The Pokemon, sensing danger, switches out when its HP becomes half or less

name: Fluffy
effect: Halves the damage taken from moves that make direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves

name: Full Metal Body
effect: Prevents other Pokemon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokemon's stats

name: Galvanize
effect: Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little

name: Grassy Surge
effect: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Innards Out
effect: Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit by the amount equal to its last HP

name: Liquid Voice
effect: All sound-based moves become Water-type moves

name: Long Reach
effect: The Pokemon uses its moves without making contact with the target

name: Merciless
effect: The Pokemon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned

name: Misty Surge
effect: Turns the gorund into Misty Terrain when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Neuroforce
effect: Powrs up moves that are super effective

name: Power Construct
effect: Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes half or less. Then the Pokemon changes its form to Complete Forme

name: Power of Alchemy
effect: The Pokemon copies the Ability of a defeated ally

name: Prism Armor
effect: Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken

name: Psychic Surge
effect: Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Queenly Majesty
effect: Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokemon, making it unable to attack using priority moves

name: Receiver
effect: The Pokemon copies the Ability of a defeated ally

name: RKS System
effect: Changes the Pokemon's type to match the memory disc it holds

name: Schooling
effect: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokemon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low

name: Shadow Shield
effect: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokemon takes while its HP is full

name: Shields Down
effect: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokemon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive

name: Slush Rush
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Speed stat in a hailstorm

name: Soul-Heart
effect: Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokemon faints

name: Stakeout
effect: Doubles the damage dealt to the target's replacement if the target switches out

name: Stamina
effect: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack

name: Steelworker
effect: Powers up Steel-type moves

name: Surge Surfer
effect: Doubles the Pokemon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain

name: Tangling Hair
effect: Contact with the Pokemon lowers the attacker's Speed stat

name: Triage
effect: Gives priority to a healing move

name: Water Bubble
effect: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokemon and prevents the Pokemon from getting a burn

name: Water Compaction
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move

name: Wimp Out
effect: The Pokemon cowardly switches out when its HP becomes half or less

name: As One
effect: This Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Glastrier's Chilling Neigh Ability/Spectrier's Grim Neigh Ability

name: Ball Fetch
effect: If the Pokemon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poke Ball from the first failed trhow of the battle

name: Chilling Neigh
effect: When the Pokemon knocks out a target, it utters a chilling neigh, which boosts its Attack stat

name: Cotton Down
effect: When the Pokemon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stat of all Pokemon except itself

name: Curious Medicine
effect: When the Pokemon enters a battle, it scatters medicine from its shell, which removes all stat changes from allies

name: Dauntless Shield
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Defense stat when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Dragon's Maw
effect: Powers up Dragon-type moves

name: Gorilla Tactics
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move

name: Grim Neigh
effect: When the Pokemon knocks out a target, it utters a terrifying neigh, which boosts its Sp. Atk stat

name: Gulp Missile
effect: When the Pokemon uses Surf or Dive, it will come back with prey. When it takes damage, it will spit out the prey to attack

name: Hunger Switch
effect: The Pokemon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of each turn

name: Ice Face
effect: The Pokemon's ice head can take a physical attack as a substitue, but the attack also changes the Pokemon's appearance. the ice will be restored when it hails

name: Ice Scales
effect: The Pokemon is protected by ice scales, which halve the damage taken from special moves

name: Intrepid Sword
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Attack stat when the Pokemon enters a battle

name: Libero
effect: Changes the Pokemon's type to the type of the move it's about to use

name: Mimicry
effect: Changes the Pokemon's type depending on the terrain

name: Mirror Armor
effect: Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokemon receives

name: Neutralizing Gas
effect: If the Pokemon with Neutralizing Gas is in the battle, the effects of all Pokemon's Abilities will be nullified or will not be triggered

name: Pastel Veil
effect: Protects the Pokemon and its ally Pokemon from being poisoned

name: Perish Body
effect: When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokemon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle

name: Power Spot
effect: Just being next to the Pokemon powers up moves

name: Propeller Tail
effect: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokemon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves

name: Punk Rock
effect: Boosts the power of sound-based moves. The Pokemon also takes half the damage from these kinds of moves

name: Quick Draw
effect: Enables the Pokemon to move first occasionally

name: Ripen
effect: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect

name: Sand Spit
effect: The Pokemon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack

name: Screen Cleaner
effect: When the Pokemon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokemon

name: Stalwart
effect: Ignores the effects of opposing Pokemon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves

name: Steam Engine
effect: Boosts the Pokemon's Speed stat drastically if hit by a Fire- or Water-type move

name: Steely Spirit
effect: Powers up ally Pokemon's Steel-type moves

name: Transistor
effect: Powers up Electric-type moves

name: Unseen Fist
effect: If the Pokemon uses moves that make direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target protects itself

name: Wandering Spirit
effect: The Pokemon exchanges Abilities with a pokemon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact
